item.title: Richard Murphy
item.description: A worldwide wealth tax? Why do it, when local progress would be so much easier? https://www.taxresearch.org.uk/Blog/2024/06/26/a-worldwide-wealth-tax-why-do-it-when-local-progress-would-be-so-much-easier/ We could, in theory, have a worldwide wealth tax, give or take up to 20 years of negotiation to get it, only to find it did not work. Or we could close the loopholes in existing laws in local tax regimes around the world and collect considerably more tax. I know what I would choose.
